intro: Sempervivum chrysanthum var. glabrum, commonly known as the silver rose or snowflake plant, is a succulent species native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features rosettes of fleshy, silver-tomentose leaves that are densely packed and often covered in a fine, white coating. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, or white during the summer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its compact growth habit and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for both garden displays and indoor cultivation.
